shorts.title: Quote of the day by Joe Biden: “Failure at some point in your life is inevitable, but giving up is unforgivable”
shorts.title_distilled: Quote of the day by Joe Biden: “Failure at some point in your life is inevitable, but giving up is unforgivable”.
shorts.description: Joe Biden’s quote, “Failure at some point in your life is inevitable, but giving up is unforgivable,” shows a philosophy transformed by decades of public service and personal challenges. The statement separates failure from quitting, making setbacks as unavoi…
shorts.content: Joe Biden’s quote, “Failure at some point in your life is inevitable, but giving up is unforgivable,” shows a philosophy transformed by decades of public service and personal challenges. The statement separates failure from quitting, making setbacks as unavoi…
shorts.content_distilled: Joe Biden’s quote, “Failure at some point in your life is inevitable, but giving up is unforgivable,” shows a philosophy transformed by decades of public service and personal challenges.

shorts.title: Senior Care Expert Peter Tomasi of Scranton Explains How to Know When It’s Time for Home Care for HelloNation

shorts.title: Gentex Unveils Ops-Core FAST XP Helmet System, A New Standard in Next-Generation Protection for Law Enforcement
shorts.title_distilled: Gentex Unveils Ops-Core FAST XP Helmet System, A New Standard in Next-Generation Protection for Law Enforcement.
shorts.description: CARBONDALE, PA, January 19, 2026 –Gentex Corporation announced the launch of the newly re-designed Ops-Core FAST XP Helmet System, a ballistic helmet solution purpose built and priced for law enforcement. Designed to meet the real-world needs ofspecialized un…
shorts.content: CARBONDALE, PA, January 19, 2026 –Gentex Corporation announced the launch of the newly re-designed Ops-Core FAST XP Helmet System, a ballistic helmet solution purpose built and priced for law enforcement. Designed to meet the real-world needs ofspecialized un…
shorts.content_distilled: CARBONDALE, PA, January 19, 2026 –Gentex Corporation announced the launch of the newly re-designed Ops-Core FAST XP Helmet System, a ballistic helmet solution purpose built and priced for law enforcement.

shorts.title: Tenor completes Commonwealth Health acquisition
shorts.description: Tenor Health Foundation completed its acquisition of Commonwealth Health and its hospitals in Scranton and Wilkes-Barre in a deal many see as a lifeline for the Scranton facilities.
shorts.content: Tenor Health Foundation completed its acquisition of Commonwealth Health and its hospitals in Scranton and Wilkes-Barre in a deal many see as a lifeline for the Scranton facilities.
shorts.content_distilled: Tenor Health Foundation completed its acquisition of Commonwealth Health and its hospitals in Scranton and Wilkes-Barre in a deal many see as a lifeline for the Scranton facilities.

shorts.title: BREAKING: Pa. Health Department OKs Tenor Health acquisition application for 3 NEPA hospitals
shorts.description: Pennsylvania Health Department officials have given their blessing to Tenor Health Foundation's application to acquire three Northeast Pennsylvania hospitals, multiple sources said Wednesday.
shorts.content: Pennsylvania Health Department officials have given their blessing to Tenor Health Foundation's application to acquire three Northeast Pennsylvania hospitals, multiple sources said Wednesday.
shorts.content_distilled: Pennsylvania Health Department officials have given their blessing to Tenor Health Foundation's application to acquire three Northeast Pennsylvania hospitals, multiple sources said Wednesday.

shorts.title: Tenor Health says NEPA hospital purchase deal remains under Pa. Department of Health review
shorts.title_distilled: Tenor Health says NEPA hospital purchase deal remains under Pa.
shorts.description: Tenor Health Foundation’s CEO said the company is ready to own and operate the Commonwealth Health Systems hospitals in NEPA, but that the transaction still awaits approval from the Pennsylvania Department of Health.
shorts.content: Tenor Health Foundation’s CEO said the company is ready to own and operate the Commonwealth Health Systems hospitals in NEPA, but that the transaction still awaits approval from the Pennsylvania Department of Health.
shorts.content_distilled: Tenor Health Foundation’s CEO said the company is ready to own and operate the Commonwealth Health Systems hospitals in NEPA, but that the transaction still awaits approval from the Pennsylvania Department of Health.

shorts.title: Peoples Security Bank and Trust supports Goodwill Industries of NEPA
shorts.title_distilled: Peoples Security Bank and Trust supports Goodwill Industries of NEPA.
shorts.description: Peoples Security Bank and Trust recently presented a check to Goodwill Industries of Northeastern Pennsylvania to help fund improvements to its existing Community Participation Supports program space in Dickson City. From left: Christopher Langan, vice president of finance/administration, Goodwill Industries of NEPA; Ann Gillerlane, director of program development and grants, Goodwill; Bill Terrinoni, senior vice president, Peoples Security Bank and Trust; and Debby Mendicino, vice president of mission services and quality compliance and assurance, Goodwill.
shorts.content: Peoples Security Bank and Trust recently presented a check to Goodwill Industries of Northeastern Pennsylvania to help fund improvements to its existing Community Participation Supports program space in Dickson City. From left: Christopher Langan, vice president of finance/administration, Goodwill Industries of NEPA; Ann Gillerlane, director of program development and grants, Goodwill; Bill Terrinoni, senior vice president, Peoples Security Bank and Trust; and Debby Mendicino, vice president of mission services and quality compliance and assurance, Goodwill.
shorts.content_distilled: Peoples Security Bank and Trust recently presented a check to Goodwill Industries of Northeastern Pennsylvania to help fund improvements to its existing Community Participation Supports program space in Dickson City.

shorts.title: HS WRESTLING: Abington Heights falls to defending state champ Bethlehem Catholic
shorts.title_distilled: HS WRESTLING: Abington Heights falls to defending state champ Bethlehem Catholic.
shorts.description: SCRANTON — Frank Scialpi and Dane Wheeler gave Abington Heights an early boost, but the Comets couldn’t keep up with defending PIAA Class 3A wrestling duals champion Bethlehem Catholic. The Golden Hawks won nine of the 13 bouts to defeat Abington Heights, 49-20, in the state first round Tuesday night at Scranton High School. “I thought we did pretty good,” Bethlehem Catholic coach Mike Cole said. “We filled in with a couple guys. We had a couple guys out, and our regulars performed well. We did what we needed to do.” View this post on Instagram Connor Gillahan, ranked No. […]
shorts.content: SCRANTON — Frank Scialpi and Dane Wheeler gave Abington Heights an early boost, but the Comets couldn’t keep up with defending PIAA Class 3A wrestling duals champion Bethlehem Catholic. The Golden Hawks won nine of the 13 bouts to defeat Abington Heights, 49-20, in the state first round Tuesday night at Scranton High School. “I thought we did pretty good,” Bethlehem Catholic coach Mike Cole said. “We filled in with a couple guys. We had a couple guys out, and our regulars performed well. We did what we needed to do.” View this post on Instagram Connor Gillahan, ranked No. […]

shorts.title: Residents voice displeasure after snow cleanup in Scranton
shorts.title_distilled: Residents voice displeasure after snow cleanup in Scranton.
shorts.description: SCRANTON, LACKAWANNA COUNTY (WBRE/WYOU) — People who live in some parts of Scranton are frustrated with the snow removal process from that winter storm more than a week ago. Many of them are demanding answers as to why some side streets are still snow-covered. 28/22 News Reporter Connor Coar was at the city council meeting [...]
shorts.content: SCRANTON, LACKAWANNA COUNTY (WBRE/WYOU) — People who live in some parts of Scranton are frustrated with the snow removal process from that winter storm more than a week ago. Many of them are demanding answers as to why some side streets are still snow-covered. 28/22 News Reporter Connor Coar was at the city council meeting [...]

shorts.title: Trains back on track after railroad reopens following train derailment
shorts.title_distilled: Trains back on track after railroad reopens following train derailment.
shorts.description: OLD FORGE, LACKAWANNA COUNTY (WBRE/WYOU) — Railroad tracks are back in service in Lackawanna County after last week's train derailment. Workers were spotted making final touches on the rails in Old Forge on Tuesday. 28/22 News crews even watched a train roll through safely. Emergency crews had responded last Monday after several railcars went off [...]
shorts.content: OLD FORGE, LACKAWANNA COUNTY (WBRE/WYOU) — Railroad tracks are back in service in Lackawanna County after last week's train derailment. Workers were spotted making final touches on the rails in Old Forge on Tuesday. 28/22 News crews even watched a train roll through safely. Emergency crews had responded last Monday after several railcars went off [...]
shorts.content_distilled: OLD FORGE, LACKAWANNA COUNTY  — Railroad tracks are back in service in Lackawanna County after last week's train derailment.
